I.  THE PROPOSED PROJECT 
 
1.  The proposed Agartala City Urban Development Project will support the Government of 
Tripura (GOT) in improving mobility and livability in Agartala city through the construction of 23 
kilometers  of  roads,  enhancement  of  48 kilometers  of  stormwater  drains,  and  renewal  of 
emblematic  open  spaces. The  project  will finance climate-resilient  and inclusive  roads  and 
strengthen the capacity of concerned agencies to ensure improved urban services delivery. The 
project is aligned with the following impact: Agartala established as an economic and commercial 
hub in northeast India with improved quality of life.1 The outcome will be livability in Agartala City 
improved. The outputs are (i) urban roads and drainage upgraded, (ii) tourist places renovated 
and made more eco-friendly, and (iii) public awareness of sanitation and hygiene, and capacity 
of concerned agencies in urban service delivery improved. The project will be financed by a 
regular ordinary capital resources loan and is estimated to cost $76.25 million. The ensuing loan 
and this transaction technical assistance (TA) are listed under the Asian Development Bank (ADB) 
country operations business plan for India, 2021–2023.2  
 
II.  THE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE 
 
A.  Justification 
 
2.  The GOT identified strengthening capacity of urban local bodies and urban governance as 
priorities to improve performance in the urban sector.3 The TA will help the GOT, specifically the 
city of Agartala, by (i) increasing knowledge and capacity development of institutions, including 
through institutional reforms; (ii) improving governance in the urban sector; (iii) improving and 
strengthening the management and operation and maintenance of urban services; (iv) increasing 
knowledge on tourism-related matters; and (v) strengthening knowledge of water conservation 
and public health.

C.  Cost and Financing 
 
4.  The TA is estimated to cost $1.1 million, of which $1.0 million will be financed on a grant 
basis by ADB’s Technical Assistance Special Fund (TASF-Others). The entire TA cost is counted 
as  part  of  the  project’s  contribution  to  climate  change  adaptation  financing.  The  eligible 
expenditure items are for recruitment of a firm of experts in relevant fields for preparing manuals 
and standards and providing advisory services and training for state and local officials. The key 
expenditure items are listed in Appendix 1.  
 
5.  The government will provide counterpart support in the form of staff, office space, and 
other in-kind contributions. The government was informed that approval of the TA does not 
commit ADB to finance any ensuing project.

3 
D.  Implementation Arrangements 
 
6.  ADB will administer the TA. The Urban Development and Water Division of ADB’s South 
Asia Department will select, supervise, and evaluate consultants. The GOT, acting through 
Agartala Smart City Limited, will be the executing agency and the Tripura Urban Planning and 
Development Authority (TUDA) will be the implementing agency. TUDA will identify and delegate 
a senior manager as the TA coordinator and will provide adequate counterpart staff to work with 
the consultants. The Empowered Committee, established under the project, will provide overall 
guidance and strategic direction for the TA.  
 
7.  The TA will be implemented over 48 months, from October 2022 to November 2026. The 
consultants will prepare a TA implementation plan before the start of services, which will include 
a timetable for deliverables defined under each output of the TA. The consultants will also submit 
interim, quarterly, and annual progress reports, in addition to other reports, as required, which will 
be reviewed by ADB and TUDA. The implementation arrangements are summarized in Table 2.
